p:
Zika virus (ZIKV) epidemics in 2015-2016 resulted in devastating effects, causing microcephaly, other related congenital defects at birth and neurodevelopmental delay after two years in children born from mothers infected by the virus during pregnancy
1– 4 . Additionally, ZIKV infection in adults correlated with a rise in the frequency of cases of Guillain-Barré syndrome
5, 6 .
